TweetTimer for Android is an app that lets you monitor a list of Twitter users to see if they are active. It does that by checking how many tweets each user has favorited in the given period of time. Our goal is to help you decide if now is a good time to post your tweet, or if it would be better to save it for later when people are more "in the mood" for fav\'ing.
This app was written by Oren Namdar (@kermit_11). Feel free to contact me at kermit11@gmail.com with anything that\'s on your mind.
Frequently Asked Questions
▶ How do I start?

The Settings button (that\'s the middle one) will allow you to add new users (by entering their Twitter usernames). Once you\'ve done that, you can go back to the main screen and press the Refresh button (on the left) to see if they had any recent activity.
▶ What are the more advanced configuration options?

The Period setting determines how much time to go back when looking for favorites. For example, if you set it for 10 minutes, only users who have fav\'d during the last 10 minutes will show up as active. The Threshold setting can be configured so that only users which fav\'d more than once lately will be shown as active.
▶ Looks great. How much?
TweetTimer is a free application. If you\'re looking for something to do with your money, I got this mail from a Nigerian prince who could really use it.
▶ Will TweetTimer post tweets on my behalf?
No. I hate that.
▶ I\'m not able to refresh. It worked just a few seconds ago!
Twitter only allows apps to check for favorites 15 times in a period of 15 minutes. This means you\'ll have to wait for this period to end before checking again.
▶ I can\'t add more users :(
Because of Twitter limitations, you\'ll only be able to monitor 15 users at a time.
